Subject: Chugalug Digest, Vol 14, Issue 126
TextBody:
Send Chugalug mailing list submissions to
	chugalug@chugalug.org

To subscribe or unsubscribe via the World Wide Web, visit
	http://chugalug.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/chugalug
or, via email, send a message with subject or body 'help' to
	chugalug-request@chugalug.org

You can reach the person managing the list at
	chugalug-owner@chugalug.org

When replying, please edit your Subject line so it is more specific
than "Re: Contents of Chugalug digest..."


Today's Topics:

 1. Re: OT: Infosec Training (Testy Test)
 2. Re: OT: Infosec Training (Testy Test)


----------------------------------------------------------------------

Message: 1
Date: Fri, 20 Sep 2013 15:14:17 -0400
From: Testy Test <testy@testytest.co>
To: Chattanooga Unix Gnu Android Linux Users Group
	<chugalug@chugalug.org>
Subject: Re: [Chugalug] OT: Infosec Training
Message-ID:
	<somelonghash@testytest.co>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"

Yes.
--
Testy Test
Owner, Awesome Place
CISSP, GSEC, OSCP
555.555.5555
testy@testytest.co




On Sep 20, 2013, at 2:35 PM, Tester Tester <moretest@testytest.com> wrote:

> Is this the same as the pentesting class you were talking about a few weeks ago? 
> 
> 
> On Fri, Sep 20, 2013 at 2:00 PM, Testy Test <testy@testytest.co> wrote:
> It will be an 8 hour class on a Saturday in December. Looking at the 14th right now. Cost will be $250.
> --
> Testy Test
> Owner, Awesome Place
> CISSP, GSEC, OSCP
> 555.555.5555
> testy@testytest.co
> 
> 
> 
>

> >

> > > "Hack Yourself First" is designed to teach system administrators how to safely hack company information systems to find the weaknesses before malicious attackers do. Learning common attack techniques and the hacker mindset will help sysadmins improve the security of company information systems and help them build more secure systems from the ground up.
